, Ross J. Anderson

:

docs.text:
Questions


Write down your answers in a piece of paper, and turn it in at the beginning of each class. You might be asked in class to exlain your answer. You can find the answers in the "readings" and "optional readings" sections.

docs.text:
Syllabus


Class meetings




When: Fr 9:30AM - 12:15PM


Where: Room 4-206K, Centre for Science 
 Tech (CST)




Who should take the course?


The course is mainly designed for PhD students and master students with a research motivation. The course requires preliminary knowledge on 
computer systems (operating systems, architecture and databases)
 and system-level programming skills. 


Grading policy


Submission of any work done by others will result in an F grade in the course, with the academic integrity violation reported to the University administration for further action. Violations include plagiarism, and usage of material available on the internet without proper attribution.




Class participation (10%)  


In-class presentation (50%): peer grading form [
link
]  


Project (40%):  


Mid-term presentation (20%)


Final demo 
 code submission (20%)








Office




Office: 4-193, CST, Yuzhe Tang


Email: ytang100@syr.edu
